page.title: 16EDUCATION IN RIPPINGALE
page.content: The village still retains its{Primary {school}which was built in 1855.There have been several improvements made to the building since that time.55 pupils aged 5-11 attend the school and there is a teaching force of a Headteacher, a Deputy and a part-time teacher for 4/10 of the week.At the age of 11, children are transfered to a Bourne grammar school or a secondary modern school at Billingborough.{Educational {spending within the county is very low and this has resulted in the demise of the school meals service,<primary pupils eat sandwiches at mid-day>,poor maintenance of buildings,<only the most urgent repairs are approved> and low provision of equipment <schools rely more upon P.T.A.s for funding>. The county has a large number of very small schools which are under constant threat of closure because of economy.
